e4: The new policy aligns with best practices in corporate governance by promoting honest and clear financial communication, reducing potential legal liabilities, and enhancing trust with stakeholders. While there may be initial misunderstandings, consistently accurate reporting reduces the risk of misinformation among clients and levels the playing field, minimizing advantages to sophisticated investors.
e5: An ethical reporting policy should prioritize transparency, accuracy, and consistency. Reporting should fairly represent financial performance without bias, enabling all investors to make informed decisions. Communication must bridge any disparities between retail and institutional investors to prevent unfair advantages. Mitigating self-interest bias and potential legal issues also strengthens ethical reporting.
e6: Yes, I would ask how the management plans to communicate the policy change to all investors effectively. Additionally, I would inquire about strategies for maintaining investor trust and any contingencies in place to address market reactions during the transition to unbiased reporting.
